result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory Keith Record was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is eligible for SAP when possible according to DOC.
Defendant is not eligible for CIP.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court remits costs, except DNA surcharge.
Payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a condition of community supervision.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample on 10-9-2015.

No contact with J.L., C.S. or the CI or known drug users.
No alcohol, no illegal drugs, no prescriptions unless approved by agent, written for defendant and taken according to doctor's instructions.
Complete all assessments, treatments and follow through as recommended by agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
